intro: Stichorkis viridiflora, commonly known as the green-flowered stichorkis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking green flowers, which are unique in coloration among its relatives. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Stichorkis viridiflora prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories.
